title: Darkins are no longer their own race....
body:
Kled just confirmed that Aatrox is a demon in runterran terms......
I don't like this really. I figured the Darkin to be a distinctive unique race and yet Riot has decided to jsut lump them in with the demons. That also mean's we'll never fidn the other darkin because it's easy to just make another demon and have people speculate it's  darkin. 
idk guys, i'm not digging this.

replies.body: I wouldn't take Kled's view on the matter as being textbook. Darkin are their own thing.
With the amount of mushroom juice Kled drinks each day, he is certainly not what I would call a credible source of information.
On the subject of Darkins, are Kayle and Morgana Darkin? Considering angels are no longer a canonical race.

> [{quoted}](name=Char97,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ABt8wWIE,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2016-07-31T05:16:24.691+0000)
>
> On the subject of Darkins, are Kayle and Morgana Darkin? Considering angels are no longer a canonical race.

No, given that Darkin are malicious entities that feed on violence, bloodshed, and negative emotions.

Malicious? That's racist. The only Darkin we know is Aatrox, the only other thing we have is the description that they are a winged immortal humanoid race that are nearly extinct.
Aatrox happens to be the only one who gets all hot and bothered about war and violence, the other two keep to themselves but just wonder Valoran and then there are the two hidden Darkin.
I dont know man, he also confirms the existance of the brain weasels and invissible badgers... so, im a bit unsure about the credibillity of what he says.

Plus if it is true the darkin could be a kind of demon and still thus be a race of their own. Fantasy races can often have variants after all. Such a line also could imply a connection more than anything else, like Kled remarking that Aatrox is so demon like that it's funny he doesn't just call himself one straight up.

Although again it could just be WAAARGHbobo taking the mick, which is definetly a part of it at least.

Actually he is mocking Aatrox for not being a demon.  (And the Narrative team member who made him)

He does actually hint what a darkin is though.  But not in that line.
"Telling people you're a god? Hell, you're barely a paring knife."?
That'd be my guess. Aatrox actually being the sword is an old theory, yeah?
It is indeed. Not sure how credible but it's always been one of the more prevalent ones.

Not necessarily.
I mean Kled might just see Aatrox as a demon,because to be honest,he really looks a lot like a demon.

Alternatively darkins might be a subrace of demons.
What does he say, exactly? You sure it was literal?

The line is "And he ain't even have the indeceny to call himself a demon."

This is both an interesting line and also WAAARGHbobo taking the piss out of Harrow; Kled's gameplay designer. For those who don't know Harrow was once one of the writers for League, and was Aatrox's primary writer.

How much of this line is completely representative of proper lore and how much is WAAARGHbobo playing fun is anyone's guess, but I'll choose to believe it's a healthy mix of the two and go from there.
Pretty neat :3 I'd like to see where they go with it.

Could be Kled taunting Aatrox about his methods being pretty demonic, could be that darkin are a kind of demon that ended up doing things differently or existed in a different form, could be that the darkin are empowered through demonic magic or something. The implications of the line, beyond WAAARHbobo just taking the mick are interesting to say the least.

This doesnt mean anything
He resembles a demon so he calls him a demon
Dont jump to conclusions

I don't think that this is actually that big a deal. There was only 1 Darkin. That was Aatrox. There have been no more since. Retconning him to be some demon, or hell, even voidborn would pull him more into the League universe rather than leaving him floating off in his own little special snowflake vignette that doesn't particularly hold with the direction that the lore has turned since his creation.
